FacilityName: Wegmans Food Markets, Inc. Frozen Foods

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Plan applies to the Wegmans Frozen Food Distribution Center refrigeration system. The facility is located  at 500 Wegmans Market Street in Rochester, New York. This RMP was prepared in accordance with the Federal Clean Air Act (CAA) Section 112r and associated regulations and ammendments CFR Part 68. This facility supplies frozen food to a subset of Wegmans stores. This system uses approximately 23,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant.



Accidental Release Prevention



The refrigeration system for Wegmans Frozen Food Distribution Center is regulated by the OSHA standard for process safety management (29CFR 1910.119). Wegmans meets the requirements for PSM at this facility and has applied this program as the Program 3 Prevention program for this RMP.



In addition to the PSM requirements, refrigeration system operators conduct regular walkdowns to assess system condition and operation. Items requiring attention are acted upon immediately. Less serious conditions are logged and remedied in a timely manner. Preventive maintenance is conducted based upon manufacturer's recommendations and using manufacturer's parts and instructions.



Emergency Response



The Frozen Food Distribution Center refrigeration system is monitored by ammonia sensors that are wired directly to Wegmans Corporate Security Operation Center, who work closely with the Gates Fire Department. In the event of an ammonia release emergency, Asset Protection will contact the Gates Fire Department and request they respond. If necessary, the Gates Fire Department will request the Monroe County HAZMAT team to also respond.



The facility has written emergency procedures. Several members of Wegmans emergency response team are trained in the use of personal protective equipment and will assist the Gates Fire Department in incident mitigation and response. The Gates Fire Department has partnered with Wegmans personnel at the facility for training purposes. Such training dr

ills are conducted periodically.



Five Year Accident History



There have been no releases during the last five years. There have been no releases in the life of the facility.



Plans to improve safety.



The local HazMat team conducts a drill at the facility, in conjunction with the Gates Fire Dept. periodically.
